page.title: 19Kirby Bellars
page.content: Kirby Bellars is a smaller village than Frisby, and lies closer to the main road (A607).The housing types are chalet bungalow,a small modern estate and a large hunting lodge now converted to flats. The Village Hall,built in 1925 is used regularly through the week by the Art Club , the Dog Training Group, W.I.and various other people on a private basis.Small fund raising events are held, usually in aid of Church funds. There is no proper shop in the village:the Post office is based in a private house,but various mobile tradespeople,including a butcher, fish & chip van and grocer call regularly. Local people were concerned by the lack of a proper shop, morning paper delivery and recreational facilities.
